page.title: 13Farming around Stonegate
page.content:
Although the land cover statistics show a dominance of grassland,the farming still shows much variety. The grassland is used for hay and silage production, and for grazing by cattle,sheep and horses.The main breeds of cattle are Friesian and Sussex.Several types of sheep are kept including Kent and Mule - the latter being a cross between a blue-faced Leicester ram and a black-faced hill- sheep ewe.Horses are kept for riding and shire horses for exhibition.
The main crops grown include barley, wheat,oats and hops. _ Goats,chicken,ducks and bees are often kept,but usually on a small scale.
